intro: Lindsaea ramosii, commonly known as the ramose lindsaea, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branching fronds that are typically covered in fine, silky hairs. Native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its rhizome is slender and often creeping, supporting the growth of its feathery leaves. Lindsaea ramosii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained, moist soil.
